intro: Jasione blepharodon, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in sunny to partially shaded environments. Its leaves are narrow and often have a hairy texture, while its stems are erect and branching. Jasione blepharodon is often found in alpine meadows and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
